Description: Ostracon (?), large section of the upper-body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of two red-painted Coptic characters.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394860) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394860)
